intro: Ruellia colonensis, commonly known as the Cuban ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and attractive, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces blue or purple flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Ruellia colonensis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant color and adaptability to various soil types. It prefers full sun to partial shade and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
